Trigger¶

The trigger module allows to define UI interactions from SASS. Events like clicks and mouseovers toggle a class of an element.

A trigger (click,mouseover,mouseout) toggles, turns on or turns off a class of its target. Also, the handlers can have priorities which allows to control the order they are executed.

Target expressions¶

The target is specified by a selector, which has some extended functionality explained below.

Target expressions are jQuery selectors plus these ones:

{this}

Can be placed everywhere in the selector an will be replaced by the id of the current element (and NOT the selector).

{parent-x}

Can be placed everywhere in the selector an will be replaced by the id of the parent number x. {parent-1} will be the first parent, {parent-2} will be the element two levels higher.

{attr-x}

Can be placed everywhere in the selector an will be replaced by the contents of the attribute of the current element. For example, it allows to put the target element in the attribute data-target by using {attr-data-target} as the target expression.

SASS¶

@mixin trigger($target_expr,$trigger_class:"trigger",$type:click,$trigger_mode:toggle,$priority:0)

Defines a trigger.

$target_expr

A target expression (see above) for the target to be triggered.

$trigger_class

Class to be triggered.

$type

click, mouseover, mouseout; Type of the event of the current element to trigger the target.

$trigger_mode

toggle, on, off; Specifies if the class of the target will be toggled, turned on or off.

$priority

The handler’s priority. The higher the number the later the handler will be executed.

@mixin triggered($trigger_class:"trigger") { @content; }

Sets class $trigger_class of the current element triggered at startup.

$trigger_class

Class to be set to on.

@mixin bp-triggered($trigger_class:"trigger") { @content; }

Pseudo-breakpoint, valid when the $trigger_class is set to on.

$trigger_class

Class.

@mixin bp-untriggered($trigger_class:"trigger") { @content; }

Pseudo-breakpoint, valid when the $trigger_class is set to off.

$trigger_class

Class.

JavaScript¶

$.trigger_enable(type, target_expr, trigger_class, trigger_mode, priority)¶

Adds a trigger to the current element. See SASS docs for more details.

Arguments:
  • type (string) – Trigger type, click, mouseover, mouseout``.
  • target_expr (string) – Target expression.
  • trigger_class (string) – Class.
  • trigger_mode (string) – Trigger mode, toggle, on, off.
  • priority (int) – Priority.
$.trigger_disable(type, target_expr, trigger_class)¶

Disables the trigger matching to the given parameters.

Arguments:
  • type (string) – Trigger type.
  • target_expr (string) – Target expression.
  • trigger_class (string) – Class.
$.trigger_set(trigger_class, mode)¶

Triggers the class with the given mode on the current element directly.

Arguments:
  • trigger_class (string) – Class.
  • trigger_mode (string) – Trigger mode, toggle, on, off.
